availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Benjamin F. Berkley (Montgomery County, Kentucky, merchant)

body.p: Montgomery County, Kentucky, merchant. Kentucky native. Married to Isabella Berkley. Farmer in Montgomery County, Kentucky, in 1850. Owned nine enslaved persons in Montgomery County in 1850. Postmaster in Montgomery County in 1855. Merchant in Montgomery County in 1860. Owned two enslaved persons in Montgomery County in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Montgomery County, District 1, p. 18A.
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Montgomery County, District 1.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Montgomery County, p. .213.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Montgomery County, p. 75A.
"Benjamin Franklin Berkley (1808-1881)," Find A Grave, Memorial 84886926, accessed January 12, 2024, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/84886926.
Record of Appointment of Postmasters, 1832-1971, Records of the Post Office Department, NARA Series M841, RG 28, Montgomery County, Kentucky, vol. 28, p. 145.
